summary.title: Aha-Secret
summary.description: aha-secret allows you to store a secret message encrypted. Only the generated link could decrypt the message again. The message is encrypted by your browser and decrypted by the browser of the person who is allowed to read it. The first time someone clicks on the link, the message is automatically deleted from the server.

threats.title: Attacker fills up disk by sending  data masses
threats.description: Attacker posts very large amount of data in order to fill up the disk
threats.mitigation:
* Ratelimit via Rack::Attack
* Low Sizelimit for payload

threats.title: Attacker fills up disk by sending many requests
threats.description: Attacker sends many requests to fill up disk or exhaust other resources
threats.mitigation: Ratelimit via Rack::Attack

threats.title: Attacker sends XSS-Payload to Reciever
threats.description: An attacker could send xss-payload to reciever to execute malicious javascript in the webrowser of the reciever
threats.mitigation:
* Using Content Security Policy using Rack::Protection
* Textarea limits possible payloads for xss

threats.title: Attacker injects SQL-commands
threats.description: Attacker injects sql commands
threats.mitigation:
* Using well known ActiveRecord-gem that uses safe methods to interact with the database
* Every record has an encrypted payload and the keys are never on the server

threats.title: An eavesdropper can read the secret payload
threats.description: An eavesdropper can read the secret payload
threats.mitigation:
* The payload is encrypted with AES256-GCM and the secret is never sent to the server
* The webapp(crypto-api.js) only works with HTTPS or on local-installations

threats.title: Encryption can be broken because of re-used Initial-Vectors
threats.description: Encryption can be broken if the same initial vector is used multiple times
threats.mitigation: Always use strong and cryptographic safe algorithm to generate random iv's

threats.title: An attacker could send a victim malicious java-script-code
threats.description: An attacker could inject javascript to trick the victim to click on a link or show the victim malicious content(porn, etc...)
threats.mitigation: Strong CSP-Policy and CORS mitigates XSS-Attacks

threats.title: An eavesdropper could intercept the traffic and read out data
threats.description: An eavesdropper could intercept the traffic and read out data. For example the bin_id.
threats.mitigation: The javascript crypto-library does only work if the backend runs on localhost or uses HTTPS

threats.title: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data
threats.description: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to produce xss or other malicious payloads
threats.mitigation:
* HTTPS
* HSTS

threats.title: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to disrupt the service
threats.description: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to disrupt the service
threats.mitigation:
* HTTPS
* HSTS

threats.title: An eavesdropper can read the secret payload
threats.description: An eavesdropper can read the secret payload
threats.mitigation:
* The payload is encrypted with AES256-GCM and the secret is never sent to the server
* The webapp(crypto-api.js) only works with HTTPS or on local-installations

threats.title: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data
threats.description: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to produce xss or other malicious payloads
threats.mitigation:
* HTTPS
* HSTS

threats.title: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to disrupt the service
threats.description: Adversary-in-the-Middle could tamper data to disrupt the service
threats.mitigation:
* HTTPS
* HSTS

threats.title: Enumerate possible payload-ids
threats.description: An attacker could try to enumerate possible id numbers of payload in order to delete secrets of other people.
threats.mitigation: Using secure token of the ActiveRecord

threats.title: An eavesdropper could intercept the traffic and read out data
threats.description: An eavesdropper could intercept the traffic and read out data. For example the bin_id.
threats.mitigation: The javascript crypto-library does only work if the backend runs on localhost or uses HTTPS

threats.title: Attacker disrupts service with flood of requests
threats.description: Attacker disrupts service with flood of requests
threats.mitigation: Ratelimit via Rack::Attack

threats.title: Reciever accidentially reveals secret and deletes it
threats.description: Reciever accidentially reveals secret and deletes it. For example, a sender creates a secret and clicks on the link instead of copy it.
threats.mitigation: Just clicking on the link does not retrieve the secret. Only a PATCH-Operation(/reveal) will fetch the secret and deletes it from the server

threats.title: Dataleak
threats.description:
The database-files could be accessed by unauthorized entities. 

For example by:
* attackers hacked the system
* administrators steal the data
* old harddisk
* aso...
threats.mitigation:
* Data is encrypted on client side
* Key is never passed on the server
* Strong encryption algorithm is used on the client side
* Data is decrypted on client side

threats.title: Attacker on server-side could manipulate data of any user
threats.description: Attacker on server-side could manipulate data of any user
threats.mitigation:
* Data is encrypted on client side
* Key is never passed on the server
* Strong encryption algorithm is used on the client side
* Data is decrypted on client side

threats.title: Decryption link leaked and an attacker got the secret
threats.description: AHA-Secret is not responsible for how the decryption-link is shared. If the link is somehow disclosed by the user and an unauthorized entity fetches the key, the secret will be compromised
threats.mitigation: Additional Password prevents this

threats.title: Supply-Chain-Attack: Backdoored dependencies
threats.description: A backdoored dependency could compromise the server. An attacker could replace the javascript files to extract the secrets on the client side.
threats.mitigation: * Reduce dependencies: no nodejs

threats.title: Vulnerable dependency allows code execution
threats.description: A vulnerability in any dependency or 3rd-party software opens a remote code execution vulnerability
threats.mitigation:
* Minimum features -> less code -> keep attack vector small
* Dependabot in Github checks for updates

threats.title: Attacker on server-side could manipulate data of any user
threats.description: Attacker on server-side could manipulate data of any user
threats.mitigation:
* Data is encrypted on client side
* Key is never passed on the server
* Strong encryption algorithm is used on the client side
* Data is decrypted on client side

threats.title: Attacker on server-side could manipulate javascript to exfiltrate secrets
threats.description: Attacker on server-side could manipulate javascript to exfiltrate secrets on the client-side.

threats.title: Decryption link leaked and an attacker got the secret
threats.description: AHA-Secret is not responsible for how the decryption-link is shared. If the link is somehow disclosed by the user and an unauthorized entity fetches the secret, it  must be detected.
threats.mitigation:
* One-Time-Secrets only! The reciever will notice that the link does not work anymore. 
* Access-Logs
* Custom passwords could prevent to read the secret with the link only

threats.title: Dataleak
threats.description:
The data could leak due to various reasons:

* attackers hacked the system
* administrators steal the data
* old harddisk
* aso...
threats.mitigation:
* Data is encrypted on client side
* Key is never passed on the server
* Strong encryption algorithm is used on the client side
* Data is decrypted on client side

threats.title: DoS because of floods of requests
threats.description: DoS because of floods of requests
threats.mitigation: Requst Ratelimit based on IP using Rack::Attack

threats.title: Server-side attacker could guess encryption-key
threats.description: An attacker is able to get the database and tries to break the encryption
threats.mitigation: Client-side autogenerated cryptographic secure random keys prevent such attacks against AES256

threats.title: Decryption link leaked and an attacker gets the secret
threats.description: AHA-Secret is not responsible for how the decryption-link is shared. If the link is somehow disclosed by the user and an unauthorized entity fetches the key, the secret will be compromised
threats.mitigation: Additional custom password prevents it

threats.title: Weak custom password leads to info-leak
threats.description: The sender uses a weak custom password that can be bruteforced on the server. Such a scenario could explose the secrets on the server side
threats.mitigation: Use custom passwords only as additional passwords. The secret is still mainly encrypted with a strong random-key

threats.title: An attacker forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on the webapp(CSRF)
threats.description: An attacker forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on the webapp(CSRF)
threats.mitigation: Using csrf-token and CORS via Rack::Protection

threats.title: Attacker denies sending payload
threats.description: Attacker denies sending malicious payloads
threats.mitigation: Access-Logs

threats.title: An attacker forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on the webapp(CSRF)
threats.description: An attacker forces an end user to execute unwanted actions on the webapp(CSRF)
threats.mitigation: Using csrf-token and CORS via Rack::Protection

threats.title: Attacker denies sending payloads
threats.description: Attacker denies sending malicious payloads
threats.mitigation: Access-Logs
